name: Colonialism on Film
description: An examination of the depiction of empires and the colonial and postcolonial experience on film. This course also introduces students to the development of national cinemas in Asia, Africa, the Caribbean and the South Pacific. The relationship between academic history and history as imagined by filmmakers is a key theme. Transnational Area
prerequisites: Any 4.0 credits, including 0.5 credit at the A- or B-level in HIS courses
